conclusion: Understanding the geometry and motion of the loop.
The side length of the equilateral triangle is \(a\). The loop is moving horizontally with velocity \(v\) to the right. Side \(CD\) is always perpendicular to the boundary \(MN\).
Calculating the length of the wire in the magnetic field as the loop moves to the right.
When point \(C\) has just entered the magnetic field, the entire side \(DE\) is inside the magnetic field, and the length of the wire inside the magnetic field is equal to the side length \(a\).
Induced EMF in a conductor moving through a magnetic field is given by \(\mathcal{E} = B \cdot l \cdot v\).
Initially, as point \(D\) enters the magnetic field and before point \(C\) enters, only a portion of the triangle's perimeter is inside the magnetic field.
The maximum induced EMF occurs when the entire side \(DE\) is inside the magnetic field.

At the moment when point \(C\) is about to enter the magnetic field, the length of the wire inside the magnetic field is \(a\). Therefore, the maximum induced EMF is \(\mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = B \cdot a \cdot v\).
The maximum value of the induced electromotive force during the process is \(\boxed{Bav}\).
